item.title: Book Club: Working Effectively With Legacy Code - Chapter 9 (Michael Feathers)
item.description: In our latest technical book club we discussed chapter 9 - ‘I Can’t Get This Class Into A Test Harness’ - of Michael Feather’s ‘Working Effectively With Legacy Code’. This chapter goes through various problems that we might have getting a class under test and then suggests different techniques to get around those problems. These are some of my thoughts and our discussion of the chapter: One approach that Feathers describes when dealing with constructors which take in a lot of values is to just pass in nulls for the parameters that we don't care about.
